lead_paragraph: RIETMAN--Jaap. 73, SoHo Pioneer, Art bookstore owner, publisher died at home January 3, 2016. Born in Holland, Jaap served in the Royal Dutch Airforce before becoming a bookseller in Holland and Switzerland. In 1968 he came to the United States and worked for Wittenborn Inc., New York City. Jaap Rietman Inc., Art Books opened on Spring Street, NYC, in 1973 specializing in art and architecture books, monographs, catalogues and magazines with a twentieth century emphasis and reach back to the Renaissance. The store became a meeting place for artists, architects and filmmakers and was a downtown institution with its three locations until 1996. Jaap was admired for his intellect and generous spirit. Survived by a brother, Hans, his beloved wife, Susan, step- son James (Emma) and three adored grandchildren Claire, Jack, Collin. He will be profoundly missed. 1/3
